articles.title: My Patient Received Dangerous AI Medical Advice. Here's The Simple Question I Wish All Doctors ...
articles.author: Huffington Post
articles.summary: "Patients and doctors need a nuanced take on the risks and benefits of using AI," says Dr. Andrew Wurzelbacher. He is a professor of computer science at the University of Cambridge.       "Patients, doctors and patients need to be aware of AI's risks and its benefits"

articles.title: Elon Musk and Sam Altman are still trading jabs over OpenAI
articles.summary: Elon Musk and Sam Altman are throwing shade at each other on X. On Sunday, Altman said Musk left OpenAI 'for dead' and accused him of stealing a non-profit. Musk and Altman cofounded OpenAI in 2015 as a nonprofit AI research company. Now it's a for-profit company effectively controlled by Microsoft.

articles.title: Will AI mean the end of call centres?
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Some commentators predict that artificial intelligence is about to replace most customer support jobs in the future, but others doubt this is the case at the moment. The future of customer support may be automated.    iReport.com will let you know more about it.

articles.title: Will AI mean the end of call centres?
articles.author: Jane Wakefield
articles.summary: According to Gartner, AI will resolve 80% of customer service issues by 2029. Salesforce's AI-powered customer service is currently being used by a range of customers from Formula 1 to Prudential, restaurant Open Table, and Reddit. Evri is investing £57m to improve its chatbot service.

articles.title: China Innovates Analog Chips, Achieving 1,000 Times Speed of Next-Generation Digital Devices This title captures the essence of the article by highlighting the innovation and significantly improved pe
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Chinese Scientists Unveil Analog Chip 1,000x faster than Nvidia and AMD's graphics processing units (GPUs) manufactured by industry leaders. The advancement could significantly impact fields like artificial intelligence and the emerging 6G wireless technology. An analog chip processes information using continuous physical signals, unlike digital chips which use discrete 1s and 0s.

articles.title: Professor leads OpenAI safety panel with power to halt unsafe AI
articles.summary: Zico Kolter is the chair of a 4-person panel at OpenAI that has the authority to halt the ChatGPT maker's release of new AI systems if it finds them unsafe. Kolter has been studying AI since the early 2000s and has been working in machine learning for 42 years. OpenAI has been accused of rushing products to market before they were fully safe to stay at the front of the race.

articles.title: AI-generated games are coming, and the wait might be short
articles.author: Digital Trends
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is moving into the games industry. Already, AI tools are helping boost frame rates and assist in development tasks, but now the games business might be next for a major shake-up due to AI tools.    Artificially intelligent tools are already helping boost frames and assist with development tasks.

articles.title: Wash. leans into AI in schools
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Washington was among the first states to introduce AI guidance to the field. Microsoft President Brad Smith said his company has been working with schools and technical and community colleges to view AI as a tool. He said it can be used to create streamlined bus schedules, or to make the most of tight budgets.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence understands feelings better than people, study finds
articles.author: Joseph Shavit
articles.summary: ChatGPT-4, Gemini 1.5 Flash, Copilot 365, Claude 3.5 Haiku, and DeepSeek V3 performed better than humans on emotional intelligence tests. The results challenge the assumption that empathy, judgment and emotional awareness exists only among humans.

articles.title: Revolutionizing Fertility: AI Pinpoints Rare Viable Sperm, Leading to Successful Pregnancy for 39-Year-Old Couple within Two Weeks
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: AI-powered sperm selection helped a 39-year-old couple who had been struggling with infertility for over two years conceive within two weeks. The advantages of incorporating AI into sperm selection are numerous, including improved IVF success rates and a more tailored approach to fertility treatment.

articles.title: Can AI Cure Hangovers?
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: AI can't cure hangovers, but it can provide helpful tips for damage control. Jackie Iversen of Sen-Jam Pharmaceutical has some thoughts on the history of hangovers and AI. She believes that alcohol abuse leads to 3 million deaths annually, and $1.7 trillion in healthcare costs. She also believes that chronic inflammation is the key to understanding aging and inflammation.

articles.title: University of Minnesota researchers launch smoke-sensing drones that one day could fight wildfires
articles.author: Alex Chhith
articles.summary: This year, 1,200 wildfires have been recorded in Minnesota so far. The University of Minnesota project is the latest research into using artificial intelligence to detect and track wildfires. The research represents a significant step toward using fully autonomous drone systems for emergency response and scientific research missions.

articles.title: AI Artist Xania Monet Becomes First to Chart on Billboard Radio Rankings
articles.summary: Xania Monet's song "How Was I Supposed to Know?" came out at No. 30 on the Adult R&B Airplay chart this week. Monet has racked up 44.4 million official U.S. streams with her catalog, equating to over $52,000 in a couple of months. Hallwood Media signed the AI artist to a multimillion-dollar record deal.

articles.title: The AI Revolution Will Bring Prosperity
articles.author: Phil Gramm
articles.summary: Most speculation about artificial intelligence has focused on its potential to kill jobs. The Industrial Revolution in the U.K. unleashed a greater concentration of material blessings than ordinary people had ever experienced. From 1840 to 1900 real wages doubled, the average lifespan increased by 22%, and employment rose by 80%.

articles.title: Robots and the Erosion of Social Trust: Navigating the Crisis of Human Authenticity
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: The increasing sophistication of artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics is blurring the lines between human and machine interaction. This progress is fueling a quiet crisis: the erosion of social trust. The core issue revolves around authenticity and our innate need to connect with real people.

articles.summary: A viral clip shows a Unitree G1 robot trying to cook inside a home and wearing a maid outfit, for some reason. It has absolutely nothing to do with male inventors' fantasies, for real. Pay no attention to the nerds incels behind the curtain.

articles.title: They Want You Relying On Artificial Intelligence So That You Will Lose Your Natural Intelligence
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: Your rulers want you to depend on machines to do your thinking for you. They want to replace the dynamic human spirit with predictable lines of code. Generative AI is just high-tech brainwashing. It is there to turn our brains into useless sludge without technological crutches.

articles.title: Microsoft hopes Mico succeeds where Clippy failed as tech companies warily imbue AI with personality
articles.author: MATT O’BRIEN
articles.summary: Microsoft introduced a new artificial intelligence character called Mico (pronounced MEE'koh) on Thursday. Mico is a floating cartoon face shaped like a blob or flame that will embody the software giant's Copilot virtual assistant and marks the latest attempt by tech companies to imbue their AI chatbots with more of a personality.

articles.title: AI data centers suck energy, water
articles.summary: AI-driven data centers are sucking energy and water from the environment. They are one of the most high-profile technology, economic development and environmental stories of the year, according to some experts.      Â  “AI data centers suck energy, water”

articles.title: Google Expands AI Footprint in India Through Strategic Reliance Partnership
articles.summary: Google is stepping up its AI initiatives in India through a new collaboration with Reliance Intelligence, the AI subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited. The partnership will provide Jio users with free access for 18 months to Google's AI Pro plan, featuring the latest Gemini 2.5 Pro model, advanced image and video generation tools, Notebook LM for research, and 2 TB of cloud storage. Google will also work to deliver localized AI experiences tailored to India's diverse user base, bringing its AI capabilities to consumers, developers, and businesses. Google Cloud is broadening access to its Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) via Reliance.

articles.title: AI Taking Its Toll on Jobs–What to Know
articles.author: The Epoch Times
articles.summary: Some major companies have recently triggered a wave of layoffs, eliminating tens of thousands of jobs. Most cited artificial intelligence integration and automation as factors behind these moves. Experts say that while a significant portion of jobs have been lost, a significant part of jobs are still being created.

articles.title: Wyoming's Artificial Intelligence Challenge: Make It Work For People, Not Other Way Around
articles.summary: Outgoing University of Wyoming President Ed Seidel is retiring at the end of the 2026 spring semester. He will be succeeded by Lars Kotthoff, who is on sabbatical in Paris. The university offers a Master of Science degree in artificial intelligence. In September, the university announced nearly $9 million in funding to advance AI innovation across Wyoming.

articles.title: The University of Alabama Where Legends Are Made
articles.summary: The University of Alabama is recognized as one of America's Top Colleges 2026 by Forbes and ranked among the top 2.4% of global universities by the Center for World University Rankings. More students chose to attend UA in 2025 than any other school in Alabama. There are 1,260 National Merit Scholars enrolled at the University. Alumni have earned some of the nation's highest honors, including 69 Goldwater Scholars, 17 Rhodes Scholars, 16 Truman Scholars and 45 Hollings Scholars. Students apply for free for the spring, summer or fall 2026 entry terms.

articles.summary: AI-altered images dress up run-down properties as being in much better shape than they actually are. Landlords are using AI to dream up imaginary facades, rooflines, and landscaping that are appealing to potential buyers.   .

articles.summary: OpenAI is planning to expand its operations in California. The company is famous for its chatbot ChatGPT. It is reorganizing into a nonprofit and a for-profit entity. California Attorney General Rob Bonta approved of the company's restructuring. California had over $1 billion in direct economic impact on the company last year.

articles.title: Autonomous AI Raises New Legal Challenges as U.S. Law Struggles to Keep Pace – [your]NEWS
articles.author: Ginika Igboke
articles.summary: Autonomous artificial intelligence (AI) systems are rapidly transforming daily life. Lawmakers are debating how to close accountability gaps, shift legal burdens, and expand liability for failures linked to autonomous systems. Colorado enacted the Consumer Protections for Artificial Intelligence Act in 2024. New York requires employers to release annual bias audits before using automated hiring tools since 2023.

articles.summary: Mustafa Suleyman, Microsoft's AI chief, is speaking at AfroTech Conference in Houston this week. He believes that only biological beings are capable of consciousness, so AI developers and researchers shouldn't pursue projects that suggest otherwise. It is intended to upscale the institution's academic stature and refine operational processes.

articles.title: The "Soft 2nd ‘Civil War' in U.S."
articles.author: L. A. "Tony" Kovach
articles.summary: There are lazy and better ways to use artificial intelligence (AI) in journalism. Multiple AI check and recheck the same drafted article or report. The article titled 'Prologue: The Long Shadow of Billionaire Warren Buffett Over Manufactured Housing and Affordable Housing Crisis – Plus Sunday Weekly MHVille Headlines Recap' is an evidence-rich exposé.

It will use LiDAR, radar, and cameras built directly into the car's design. Next year, its cars will feature conversational AI powered by Google Gemini. Eventually, GM plans to replace it with its own in-house AI assistant.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is rapidly expanding and tech companies are looking for ways to embed the technology into people's everyday lives. articles.title: It's Easier to Cheat When You Can Blame AI
articles.author: Lisa Ward
articles.summary: People are more likely to cheat when they delegate a task to artificial intelligence instead of doing it themselves, according to a new study. Participants were shown 10 die rolls on a computer screen and told to report the numbers. The higher the numbers rolled, the more money they would earn.

articles.author: William A. Haseltine
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is transforming how we detect, prevent and treat illness. articles.summary: There is a prescribed burn taking over a 30-acre prairie at Cedar Creek Ecosystem Science Reserve, north of the Twin Cities. Five drones are flying over the prairie, collecting data on the smoke and sending it to a computer on the ground. The computer analyzes the data to understand the fire's flow patterns. The project is the latest research into using artificial intelligence to detect and track wildfires.

It is based on their research on molecular tumour profiling and artificial intelligence. It's based on a review paper published by the journal "Cancer Research International".

articles.title: How Wall Street is really using AI — from staff training to performance reviews
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase has a technology budget of $18 billion. Citi's AI tools have saved 100,000 developer hours a week with automated code reviews. Goldman's chief data officer melds with the rest of the bank to get the most out of its data. Bank of America's AI rollout is well underway.

articles.title: Raising a brow at beauty app scores
articles.author: Lori Borgman
articles.summary: Beauty analysis apps score your face on a scale of 1-10. Some of the apps require users to be age 16+. The majority have no age restrictions whatsoever. They prey on insecurities of tweens and teens. True beauty has an abstract quality that transcends the physical.

articles.title: Apple (AAPL) Delivers Solid Beat — Jefferies Softens Bearish Stance
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is one of the AI Stocks on the Market's Radar. Jefferies upgraded the stock rating from 'Underperform' to 'Hold' and raised the price target to $246.99 from $203.07. Apple's September quarter revenue growth of estimated 8%, topping both Jefferies estimates and consensus expectations by 6% and 1%. The iPhone's revenue growth was weaker at 6%. Other products, including Mac and iPad outperformed expectations. The company's gross margin of 47.2% beat estimates by an estimated 0.5%. It has guided for 10%-12% revenue growth in the December quarter.

articles.title: Interview: China illuminates global digital future with "responsible AI technology and human-centered vision" -- Kuwaiti official
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Sheikh Mohammed Al-Sabah is chairman of Kuwait's Association of Artificial Intelligence of Things. He is also a member of the AITAID's board of directors. He's also the chairman of the Kuwait's AITI Board of Trustees.

articles.title: ChatGPT Admits Its Limit, 'New Rules' Ban Specific Legal, Health, Money Tips
articles.author: Briane Nebria
articles.summary: ChatGPT will no longer give specific medical, legal or financial advice as of October 29th. It is now an 'educational tool' and can only explain principles, outline general mechanisms and tell you to talk to a doctor, lawyer or financial professional. Big Tech doesn't want lawsuits on its plate. ChatGPT excels at being 'convincingly wrong'

articles.title: All Eyes on Bloom Energy's (BE) Backlog as Jefferies Lifts PT but Keeps 'Underperform'
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Bloom Energy Corporation (NYSE:BE) is one of the AI Stocks on the Market's Radar. Jefferies raised its price target on the stock to $53.00 from $31.00 and maintained an 'Underperform' rating. The recent BAM deal is the primary reason for the price target increase.

articles.title: Prediction: AMD's Stock Could Soar on Nov. 4
articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices and OpenAI recently announced a huge partnership. AMD's data center revenue only rose by 14% year over year and fell 12% quarter over quarter in Q2. OpenAI will help AMD develop its ROCm software, which is needed to control its graphics processing units (GPUs). AMD's last report left a lot to be desired.

articles.title: Inside the race to train AI robots how to act human in the real world
articles.author: Nilesh Christopher
articles.summary: Naveen Kumar, 28, works for a startup that creates physical data used to train AI. His company, Objectways, sent 200 towel-folding videos to its client in the United States. The company has more than 2,000 employees, about half of them label sensor data from autonomous cars and robotics and the rest work on generative AI.

articles.title: Is OpenAI Becoming Too Big to Fail?
articles.author: Tim Higgins
articles.summary: OpenAI hasn't yet turned a profit, but its annual revenue is 2% of Amazon's sales. Its future is uncertain beyond the hope of ushering in a godlike artificial intelligence that might help cure cancer and transform work and life as we know it.

articles.title: People, Culture, And Customers: The Real AI Adoption Challenge
articles.author: Alison Coleman
articles.summary: The most common challenges of AI adoption are integration and usage (72%) and concerns about data and privacy (70%) According to research, a lack of understanding about AI's benefits (62%) and lack of in-house resources (60%) is the main reason for non-adoption. The biggest cultural barrier to AI adoption is trust and alignment. Anh Ly, founder and CEO of Mim Concept, found reconciling technology with the soul of design to be the most significant challenge.

articles.title: Saudi Arabia is making a massive bet on becoming a global AI powerhouse
articles.author: Tala Alrajjal
articles.summary: Humain wants to make Saudi Arabia the world's third-largest AI market after the United States and China. The Kingdom's competitive edge lies in its abundant and cheap energy resources that can feed the insatiable demand for computing power, according to Humain's CEO.

articles.title: The New York College Trying to ‘AI-Proof' Its Students
articles.author: Hugh Cameron
articles.summary: Paul Smith's College in New York's Adirondack mountains has seen a 30 percent increase in new enrollees this fall. It prepares students for 'hands-on' professions even advanced LLMs will struggle to supplant. The college has always tailored its curriculum toward land-based occupations and the more rural trades.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence should never replace talented animators and artists [column]
articles.author: Charlie White
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence threatens the livelihood of millions of artists worldwide. According to The Society of Authors, more than a quarter of illustrators have already lost work to AI. The Animation Guild estimates that about 118,500 jobs in TV, film and animation will be negatively affected by AI by next year. Charlie White is in the 12th grade at Warwick High School.

articles.title: A parent's guide to ChatGPT and artificial intelligence
articles.author: Lydia Seabol Avant
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI-powered app that makes life easier for its users. It helps with writing, proofreading, brainstorming ideas and finding the cheapest tire replacement for a car. It's made the workday more efficient and boosted productivity by a third.

articles.title: This AI authorship protocol aims to keep humans connected to thinking
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can help students write better essays, but it's not always clear if it's a professional who wrote the essay or a student who wrote it. The relationship between teacher and student is under strain. Some universities are trying to make assignments 'AI-proof'

articles.title: Cursor AI: Coding Model & Multi-Agent Interface Revealed
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Cursor's new AI-powered Composer allows developers to run multiple AI agents in parallel, effectively creating an internal 'competition' for the best solution. Cursor's approach points to the rise of AI orchestration and the focus will shift to intelligently combining the strengths of multiple models.

articles.title: will convert them into 4K versions without you doing anything
articles.author: Omar El Sayed
articles.summary: YouTube has announced it's leveraging the power of Google's artificial intelligence to upscale older videos. It's a signal of YouTube's broader investment in artificial intelligence. YouTube's AI upscaling is essentially a digital restoration project on an unprecedented scale. Creators will retain full control over their content.

articles.title: I asked ChatGPT for the ‘next Nvidia stock'. Here are 5 names it gave me…
articles.author: Edward Sheldon
articles.summary: ChatGPT suggested AMD, ASML, Advanced Micro Devices, Nvidia, Oracle, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company as potential growth stocks for the next Nvidia. Edward Sheldon has positions in Nvidia, Hesai Group, and ASML. Hesai is a Chinese company that specialises in LiDAR (remote sensing) technology.

articles.title: AI artist makes debut on Billboard radio chat
articles.summary: Billboard says Xania Monet is the first AI artist to earn enough radio airplay to debut on the Billboard radio chart. On NPR, they play News 88.9 KNPR Live, Classical 89.7 KCNV Live and On Air Now Playing Newscast.

articles.title: AI Adoption: Checklist for Safe & Successful Implementation
articles.author: Luis Mendoza
articles.summary: Sports organizations have a history of chasing the next big thing, from 3D broadcasts that fizzled to the NFT hype cycle, but the potential of Artificial Intelligence remains surprisingly sluggish. The key to successful AI implementation isn't a wholesale overhaul, but a measured, strategic approach. AI should focus on solving specific problems.

articles.title: Does AI Have a Place in the Pulpit?
articles.author: Jonathan Gibson
articles.summary: The Rev. Christopher Benek uses artificial intelligence to improve his productivity when writing sermons. Exponential network surveyed 650 church leaders and found that 64 percent used AI to help prepare or write sermons this year. Kenny Jahng, an ordained evangelical pastor from New Jersey, is a big proponent of AI in religious contexts.

articles.title: New Developments Are Causing People To Panic. Heres Why
articles.author: Robin Westenra
articles.summary: Dive into Palantir's Maven AI weapons, expanded to $1.3B in Pentagon contracts, and Oracle's Defense Ecosystem for national security AI. Explore quantum military tech breaking encryption, Trump's AI Action Plan centralizing data, and biblical prophecies.

articles.title: Using Generative AI To Test Some Other Generative AI On Providing Safe Mental Health Advice To Humans
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: Using AI to test other AIs on their mental health advice is an innovative and clever use of AI to assess whether another AI is capable of giving out proper advice. There is a growing concern that AI could fall into a form of psychosis, often informally labeled as AI psychosis.

articles.title: I'm raising a brow at beauty app scores
articles.author: Lori Borgman
articles.summary: Beauty analysis apps score your face on a scale of 1-10. Some of the apps require users to be at least 16, but the majority have no age restrictions whatsoever. They prey on insecurities of tweens and teens. True beauty has an abstract quality that transcends the physical.

articles.title: Dodgers Conquer the World Series: Max Power Unleashed!
articles.summary: In today's digital landscape, a strong online presence is crucial for success. Search Engine Optimization, or SEO, is the cornerstone of achieving that presence. It's an ongoing process with distinct phases. Technical teams handle the technical aspects, while content creators and marketers focus on content development and promotion.

articles.title: Chatgpt Is Not a Psychologist, but It Will Change Your Language to Alert Users with Mental Health Problems
articles.summary: Sam Altman's company is changing the responses of the most famous Generative Artificial Intelligence to mental health problems. The company has trained the system with the help of more than 170 mental health specialists with recent clinical experience. OpenAI has also announced the change of model to start earning money.

articles.title: AI Pioneer Says Tech Profits Depend on Replacing Workers
articles.author: Geoffrey Hinton
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton, the Nobel laureate in AI, warns that AI will only generate returns if companies replace large numbers of human workers with AI. He says the primary path to profitability lies in using AI to cut labor costs, which is where tech giants are betting on it.

articles.title: Google Pixel Outperforms iPhone in SMS Protection: Insights from Börse Express
articles.author: Omar El Sayed
articles.summary: Androids offer superior protection against smishing attacks. Google's Pixel devices demonstrate a 96% reduction in fraud attempts. iPhone users are 65% more likely to receive three or more spam texts each week. Global Anti-Scam Alliance estimates that global losses due to scams will exceed $1 trillion by the end of 2024.

articles.title: AI Surge Sparks $200 Billion Boom in Credit Market Issuance
articles.author: support101@QUE.com
articles.summary: The global financial markets have been profoundly transformed by the integration of artificial intelligence (AI). This technological evolution has redefined how financial institutions operate and catalyzed a substantial boom in credit market issuance valued at a staggering $200 billion. AI presents numerous opportunities and challenges for both investors and borrowers.

articles.title: Can AI Cure Hangovers?
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI can't cure hangovers, but it aids research on inflammation, aging and the body's immune response. It's not a cure for hangovers but it's useful for research on the human body. It can help scientists understand the human immune system.

articles.title: ChatGPT just helped me solve a big Gmail problem—and I've finally reached inbox zero
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: ChatGPT recently helped me solve a Gmail problem. It's a prime example of how I now use chatbots.    .      in the chatbot chatbot app, ChatGPT, is available in Google Play and in Apple's App Store.

articles.title: These 5 ChatGPT Prompts Can Save You Valuable Time At Work
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: ChatGPT can help streamline your workday when given the proper guidance. Here are 5 prompts that enable ChatGPT to deliver a tailored response to the user's needs.      Â   i.e. "What are the questions you need to provide a tailored reply?"

articles.title: The Amount of Money OpenAI Lost Last Quarter Will Make You Choke on Your Slurpee
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: OpenAI lost $11.5 billion in the last quarter, according to Microsoft's latest earnings report. The Register reports that the figure is representative of the dizzying spending in the AI industry at the moment. The company's partner, ChatGPT, made $11 billion last quarter.

articles.title: KUWAIT-KUWAIT CITY-CHAIRMAN OF KUWAIT'S AAIOT-XINHUA-INTERVIEW
articles.author: Bahrain News
articles.summary: Sheikh Mohammed Al-Sabah is chairman of Kuwait's Association of Artificial Intelligence of Things. He will be inaugurated on Nov. 2, 2025 in Kuwait City.    xinhua.com.uk/news/index.html?newslink=top

articles.title: If You Treat AI Like Software, You'll Miss The Real Transformation
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI transformation isn't about tools, it's about redesigning work and building new operating models. It's about helping people thrive alongside intelligent systems, not just using them.       .   for more information, go to: www.ai-transformation.com.

articles.title: Tsinghua Scientists Create Light-Powered AI Chip Running at 12.5 GHz
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: Researchers at Tsinghua University have created the world's fastest optical AI chip, the OFE², which processes data using light at 12.5 GHz. The chip performs pattern-recognition tasks efficiently and is capable of processing data at high speeds.

articles.title: Fortytwo's decentralized AI has the answer to life, the universe, and everything
articles.author: The Register
articles.summary: Fortytwo was founded last year based on the idea that a decentralized swarm of small AI models running on personal computers offers scaling and cost advantages over centralized AI services. There are no datacenters required for such a swarm.      Â

articles.title: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman to developers and researchers: Stop pursuing projects that …
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Microsoft AI chief Mustafa Suleyman has advised developers and researchers to stop pursuing projects that suggest artificial intelligence (AI) is capable of consciousness. He said that only biological beings possess this trait and that the pursuit is misplaced. He believes that if you ask the wrong question you get the wrong answer.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 8:26 a.m. EST
articles.summary: Zico Kolter is a professor and a member of the OpenAI safety panel. The panel has the power to stop OpenAI from releasing new AI systems if they are deemed unsafe by the panel and can stop them from being released.    .
